title.rendered: Cob Houses An Ode to Sturdy Mud Architecture

content.rendered:
Thinking out of the square is a feted and evocative notion. The popularity of the phrase is proportionate to its evocativeness as it coerces to think innovatively, to approach problems from a new perspective, and find solutions inversely. When it comes to the building industry, thinking out of the box means thinking beyond conventional construction flair. In the world of high-rise buildings, sturdy mud architecture is the stoutest combat. The main constituent of sturdy mud architecture is the mixture of mud and straw to form cob houses. In the early days of the settlement of human beings, cob was used to build lodgings. With the progression in the architecture industry, the trend of cob or sturdy mud architecture becomes timeworn.

Needless to say, the leanings in the construction industry are ever-changing. New trends of construction and new designs are persistently entering into the mainstream. However, the replacement of the old trends is also reported temporary. Undeniably, new and old trends are sealed in a cyclic casket. The yearning of people for the cob houses is the evidence of this fact. In addition to this, it is investigated that the trend of ultra-luxury habitat is shifting to off-grid housing. People still want to have the houses build-up by the natural building material i.e. cob.

History of Cob Houses

Cob is the natural building material, its origin dates back to the thirteenth century. Starting from the early days of human existence till present, cob is credited to be used in construction due to its versatility and pervasive accessibility. With the commencement of the fifteenth century, cob cottages have already become a norm of construction. Therefore, it is the oldest construction material on earth. Notably, it is reported that almost a third and a half of the world’s’ population used to live in the cob houses. The popularity of the cob houses also lies in the fact that cob houses can be set up in any of the climates all over the world. Significantly, cob material is famous for many appellations such as adobe, splashed clay, sturdy mud, clay daubing, etc.

Perks of Cob Houses

The profuse benevolence of the sturdy mud architecture is evident. For that building cob houses are the perfect alternative to contemporary construction. Whosoever wants to have effusively sustainable living are testified to go for energy-efficient houses that are inexpensive and artistically beautiful. In addition to this, the natural building material makes the construction easy without any appliance of high-tech equipment or special drilling. However, the perks of cob houses are infinite some of the most prolific perks are mentioned below.

  • The first and foremost benefit of cob houses is that these are budget-friendly. The availability of the building material under our foot makes its construction budget-friendly. It is worthy to mention that for the construction of cob house, sturdy mud, straw, and a place of land is required. The cost of a cob house is almost one-tenth of the conventionally build house.
  • One another the most significant perk of having a cob house is its variance in thermal performance. Because the sturdy mud dwellings have their energy-efficient designs. Notably, cob is a natural material that can engross greater qualities of heat naturally.
  • Sustainability and durability is another eminent perk of cob constructions. Needless to say, cob is a mixture of natural ingredients e.g. mud and straw which are exclusively eco-friendly and durable. It is surveyed that if a cob house is looked after properly, it would have a long lifespan can endure the ferocity of nature in the form of natural disasters.

To sum up, the burning and earthquake resistance, health assurance due to the negation of chemicals, the building flexibility, and termite-proof are included.
